description: The underlying elliptic curve is secp256r1.
The message digest for hashing the input is SHA-512/256.
Signatures consists of two parts r,s where r,s are encoded as unsigned, bigendian, fixed-length byte arrays.

Basic.desc: Basic test vectors use the simplest possible inputs. These inputs often overlap with inputs from standards and RFCs. One goal of such test vectors is to simply detect distinct algorithms.

InvalidRange.desc: The test vector contains a signature where r and/or s are not in the correct range.

PointAtInfinity.desc: The test vector contains a signature with special case values that lead to a point at infinity during signature verification.

PsychicSignature.desc: The signature contains trivial values such as 0. If the verification is not correctly implemented then it is possible that such signature are verified.
PsychicSignature.effect: Accepting such signatures may result in universal forgeries.

SpecialAB.desc: The test vector contains a signature with special case values for the values A and B. These values are chosen to check for arithmetic exceptions during the signature verification.

SpecialR.desc: The test vector contains a signature with special case value for the point R. These values are chosen to check for arithmetic exceptions during the signature verification.

SpecialRS.desc: The test vector contains a signature with special case value for r and s. These values are chosen to check for arithmetic exceptions during the signature verification.

SpecialU12.desc: The test vector contains a signature with special case values for the value u1 and u2. These values are chosen to check for arithmetic exceptions during the signature verification.

WrongHash.desc: The test vector contains a signature that is valid if the wrong hash function is being used to verify the signature.

tests.comment: r and s^-1 are 16 bit integers
r and s^-1 are 64 bit integers
r and s^-1 are edge case 64-bit integers
R: x-coordinate close to p (invalid signature)
R: x-coordinate close to p (invalid signature)

point at infinity during verify (invalid signature)

wrong hash: using SHA-256 instead of SHA-512/256 (invalid signature)
wrong hash: using SHA3-256 instead of SHA-512/256 (invalid signature)
wrong hash: using KECCAK256 instead of SHA-512/256 (invalid signature)
wrong hash: using SHA-512 instead of SHA-512/256 (invalid signature)
